results.headline: Review: In ‘The Hallow,’ Evil Lurks in the Irish Woods
results.summary_short: The title of Corin Hardy’s horror film refers not to a place, but to the vicious supernatural beings who inhabit a forest paradise.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Hallow

results.headline: Review: ‘In the Basement,’ What Lies Beneath in Austria
results.summary_short: Ulrich Seidl gives viewers a tour of the private hobbies practiced in the unseen, unfortunately decorated spaces of Austrian homes.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In the Basement

results.headline: Review: In ‘Spectre,’ Daniel Craig Is Back as James Bond, No Surprise
results.summary_short: There’s nothing unexpected in Spectre, the 24th “official” title in the series, which is presumably as planned.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Spectre

results.headline: Review: In ‘Palio,’ Sights and Sounds of This Sienese Horse Race
results.summary_short: Cosima Spender’s documentary focuses on the 2013 race and the competition between two jockeys.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Palio

results.headline: Review: In ‘Lost in the Sun,’ a Motherless Teenager Teams Up With a Petty Crook
results.summary_short: Starring Josh Duhamel and Josh Wiggins, this film follows the open-road adventure of a somewhat unlikely pair.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lost in the Sun

results.headline: Review: Bryan Cranston in ‘Trumbo,’ as a Screenwriter in a Hollywood Under Siege
results.summary_short: Directed by Jay Roach, the film tells the personal story of one of the Hollywood 10.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Trumbo

results.headline: Review: Jacques Rivette’s 1971 Film, ‘Out 1: Noli Me Tangere’
results.summary_short: This newly restored, nearly 13-hour French movie, with English subtitles, is having its New York theatrical premiere.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Out 1: Noli Me Tangere

results.headline: Review: Resettling the Meaning of Home in ‘Brooklyn,’ With Saoirse Ronan
results.summary_short: This film about a familiar American story, the immigrant who arrives with dreams of the future and pangs over leaving home, explores the question: Where do we come from?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brooklyn

results.headline: Review: ‘In Jackson Heights,’ an Ode to the Immigrant Experience
results.summary_short: Frederick Wiseman’s documentary about this Queens neighborhood advances the idea that it is people — in streets and stores, in barbershops and laundromats — who make a city great.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In Jackson Heights

results.headline: Review: ‘The Price We Pay’ Maps a Web of Offshore Tax Havens
results.summary_short: Harold Crooks’s documentary shows how the global financial system abets the growing concentration of wealth within a narrow minority.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Price We Pay

results.headline: Review: ‘How to Change the World’ Traces the Roots of Greenpeace
results.summary_short: This documentary captures the excitement of the make-it-up-as-you-go early days, as well as the stresses that follow when a movement takes off.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of How to Change the World

results.headline: Review: ‘The Armor of Light’ Follows 2 Unlikely Allies Against Gun Violence
results.summary_short: This documentary depicts a white evangelical conservative and the mother of a black shooting victim in Florida as they press their case.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Armor of Light

results.display_title: Scouts Guide To The Zombie Apocalypse
results.headline: Review: ‘Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse’
results.summary_short: In Christopher Landon’s horror comedy, three teenage boys and a strip-club dancer battle the undead.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Scouts Guide To The Zombie Apocalypse

results.headline: Review: ‘McCullin’ Captures a Photojournalist’s View of Covering the World
results.summary_short: This documentary takes a plain-spoken approach to covering the career of Don McCullin, a longtime correspondent for The Sunday Times of London who has photographed strife around the world.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of McCullin

results.headline: Review: ‘Love,’ Gaspar Noé’s Romance Told Through Sex
results.summary_short: This fourth film from the Argentine director tells the story of a couple through physical encounters.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Love

results.headline: Review: In ‘Our Brand Is Crisis,’ the War Room Goes to Bolivia
results.summary_short: This comedy, a fictional version of a documentary by the same name about the 2002 Bolivian election, mostly provides a stage for Sandra Bullock.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Our Brand Is Crisis

results.headline: Review: In ‘Hard Labor,’ a Brazilian Couple’s Unsettling Struggle
results.summary_short: The filmmakers at times evoke the ambient dread and decay of, say, Roman Polanski’s “Repulsion.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hard Labor

results.headline: Review: In ‘Bare,’ a Bored Woman Takes Up Pole Dancing
results.summary_short: Dianna Agron of “Glee” stars as someone who flees a staid existence after meeting a drug-dealing drifter.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bare

results.headline: Review: ‘Heneral Luna’ Is a Patriotic Biopic That Aspires to Epicness
results.summary_short: The film tells the story of Antonio Luna, who in the late 1800s led the Philippine Revolutionary Army during the Philippine-American War.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Heneral Luna

results.headline: Review: ‘Flowers’ Leaves Three Women Pining for the Same Lost Love
results.summary_short: This melodrama directed by Jon Garaño and Jose Mari Goenaga follows how lives are altered after one woman receives anonymous weekly bouquets.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Flowers
